$eref.description: The total number of shares a company has issued
A parcel of shares in a company

___voting_percentage_max.description: Maximum percentage of votes (if for example a band of votes is given)

___shareholders.description: Legal persons who own this share parcel

___name.description: Name of natural person or company

___type.description: Type of person if known (company or natural person)

___address_country.description: Country part of owner's address (for example if address not given)

___company_number.description: Company number, if company and known

___percentage_of_shares_max.description: Maximum percentage of shares (if for example a band of percentage is given)

___share_class.description: Share class or classes, if known

___voting_percentage_min.description: Minimum percentage of votes (if for example a band of votes is given)

___percentage_of_shares_min.description: Minimum percentage of shares (if for example a band of percentage is given)

$eref.name: PreviousName
$eref.description: A previous name of a company

___con_date.description: The end (conversion) date of the name

___jurisdiction_code.description: Code representing the jurisdiction/company register which is the canonical record of the company’s existence. Uses underscored ISO 3166-2 to represent it, e.g. es for Spain, us_de for Delaware

___all_attributes.description: Other arbitrary attributes for a given company

___registered_agent_name.description: The 'Agent' of the company – a person or entity that is empowered to accept service for the company

___home_legal_name.description: The legal name of the 'home' company in its jurisdiction if this is a branch, and the name is different from the legal name of the branch

___jurisdiction_of_origin.description: The jurisdiction of the 'home' company if this is a branch

___home_company_number.description: If the entity is a 'branch', this is the company_number of the 'home' company in the home company's jurisdiction

___registered_agent_address.description: The address of the 'Agent', a public address to which legal papers can be served

___merged_into.description: Information on the merger of this company into a 'survivor' company

___surviving_company.description: the surviving_company that this has been merged into

___name.description: The legal name of the surviving company

___jurisdiction.description: The jurisdiction of incorporation of the surviving company

___company_number.description: The company_number of the surviving company, if known
unique identifier given by the corporate register with which it is incorporated

$eref.description: An officer (director, senior executive) of a company

___type.description: The type of entity that is the officer (either 'Person' or 'Company')

___person_uid.description: a unique identifier given to the individual (as opposed to the officership)

___uid.description: a unique identifier given to the officership

___jurisdiction.description: A free text field for the jurisdiction where the company is registered – this can be either the ISO 3166-2 code, the underscored version, or the standard name for the jurisdiction, e.g. France

$eref.description: An industry code from a standard code list (e.g. NAICS 2007 or NACE 2). This schema is a sub-schema of Classification.

___code_scheme_id.description: An identifier representing industry code scheme. At the moment these are eu_nace_2, uk_sic_2003, uk_sic_2007, us_naics_2002, us_naics_2007, be_nace_2008, dk_db_2007, nz_bic_2006, no_sic_2007, anz_sic_2006, nz_bic_2006, in_nic_2004_mca, ca_qc_cae, lu_nace_2. For other code schemes, or details of these, contact info@opencorporates.com

$eref.description: An identifier for an entity (possibly other things, e.g. securities in the future). Examples are tax IDs, non-profit IDs, SEC CIK numbers, Federal Reserve RSSD id. The main requirements for an identifier is that they should be well-defined, and issued by a government or have statutory standing

___identifier_system_code.description: An identifier representing the identifier scheme. Some examples of this are us_fein (US Federal tax number), us_sec_cik (US Securities and Exchange Commission CIK), uk_ew_cc (Charity Commission of England & Wales), lei (Global Legal Entity Identifier System)

___uid.description: The unique identifier given by the identifier system – it should be unique in the context of the identifier_system

$eref.description: An alternative name of a company, e.g. abbreviation, trading (including dba or doing business as), legal. As well as trading names etc, it can be used for storing alternative language representations of the legal name, in which case the language should be represented as two-letter ISO-639 code

___branch.description: A flag to denote whether a company is a branch entity. This should only be set if the company is a type of branch (otherwise should be null). In general the only option here is 'F' for a 'Foreign' branch, i.e. an out-of-jurisdiction entity that has registered as having a presence in the jurisdiction. In the US this is sometimes called a Foreign Corporation
